multiple_choice.choice: One of two factors necessary to produce concentrated urine
Comprised of countercurrent multiplication and countercurrent exchange.
Taking place down and up the descending and ascending limbs of the loop of Henle.

response.feedback: Incorrect.The osmotic gradient needed to produce concentrated urine depends on two chief factors. One of these processes is called the countercurrent flow of fluid. It occurs down and up the descending and ascending limbs of the loop of Henle. Two countercurrent mechanisms operate in the kidneys: countercurrent multiplication and countercurrent exchange.
